alert.note: Alert for Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 9:13PM PDT until March 16 at 1:40AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Sacramento CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Above Bend Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Butte and Glenn Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours is producing significant rises on the upper Sacramento river system. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Red Bluff Diversion Dam, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Sacramento River below Red Bluff Diversion Dam. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 259.6 feet, Extensive flooding problems begin to happen in low lying areas of Red Bluff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 253.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 259.0 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 255.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 260.0 feet on 01/02/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued later tonight.Wednesday evening at 645 PM PDT.
